CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, June 23, 1962, pg. 1, reads: "Where Body Was Thrown - Myrtle Todd (left), 16, cousin of the victim, and Sherril, 13, point to the spot in culvert, at the bottom of a ravine, off the Homestead Duquesne Road, where the lifeless, multi-stabbed body of Mavis Todd, 20-year-old nurse, was found on Saturday morning, last week. - Harris Photo." Portion of accompanying article reads: "W. Mifflin Man Admits Slaying - Cement Worker Bludgeons Nurse; Hides Her Body - Clarence Mitchell, 28, of 3715 Homestead Ave., West Mifflin, confessed to the brutal slaying of Mavis Todd, 20, nurses aide of West Mifflin..."
TitMainTitle: Sherril Todd and Myrtle Todd, pointing to culvert, site of murder of Mavis Todd, West Mifflin, another version
CatSubject_tab: Women--Pennsylvania--West Mifflin.Trees--Pennsylvania--West Mifflin.Crime scenes--Pennsylvania--West Mifflin.Teenagers--Pennsylvania--West Mifflin.
